page.title: 04VICTORIA PARK
page.content: {Victoria Park { }The park was dedicated in April 1897 to honour Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee. 57 acres bought by Warrington Borough Council formed the original park. Its present size is 90 acres. Recreation facilities include: The athletics stadium; used mainly by Warrington Athletic Club,County events are also held there. The fitness trail; 722 metreslong with 14 sets of exercise equipment. There are also 10 pitches and 3 greens for many sports and games,and 80 allotments rented by the public. Because of its size Victoria Park is chosen for important local events such as; Walking Day Fair,Festival (carnival and parade),Community bonfire and firework display,exhibitions,rallies and galas.
